author: Denver37

review: When I first got it, I immediately ran into the HDCP required for playback error. I managed to get around this by doing the (what should be unnecessary) song and dance of unplugging and turning things off and on, and it worked for a while. I then made the mistake of updating the software. Now, all I get is the HDCP error. So I put it aside for a bit, and recently bought a brand new plasma tv. Boom, same HDCP error. If you're looking to watch netflix, I'd much rather recommend a hdmi cord and connect your laptop to it. Apple clearly doesn't care about quality anymore, or even delivering a product that actually works.EDIT: 1/9/2014 Oddly enough, the fix for this was getting a new hdmi cord. This is strange, seeing as the original cord works for everything else, but at least it works now. Love my Apple TV, but it does make you jump through hoops to get it to work. For example, the audio often gets out of sync with the video, and the only fix is to restart the unit. I probably have to do this every other day. Still, I'm very happy with it, and have changed my rating from one to four stars.
author: Kyle Damken

review: There's no better experience out there in streaming devices.  You'll be happy with this, especially if you own Apple products. Decent price with the benefit of Apple's ecosystem, too, at $89 from Amazon. At this seller's price, the remote must be plated with 24k.

review: Dude, Apple TV supplements where you do not want to buy a Smart TV.
